task.title: Modify a security group using the User Console

taskbody.context: In this section of the lab exercise you will use the Eucalyptus User Console to modify the firewall rules associated with a security group.

step.cmd: On the Debian desktop in the User Console window, click the Network & Security icon and then select Security Groups.

info.p: The Manage security groups window opens.

step.cmd: Click the check box next to your mygroup security group in order to select it.
Click More actions and then select Manage rules from the menu.

info.p: The Manage security group rules window opens.

step.cmd: In the Manage security group rules window, select Custom ICMP as the protocol, Echo reply for the port range, and allow traffic from 0.0.0.0/0. Then click the Save changes button.
Click the plus symbol next to your security group in order to see its firewall rules. You might have to click Refresh in order to see the newest rule.
From the Debian desktop, open an xterm window and ping the public IP address of your running instance.

info.p: Did it work? It should have. Use Ctrl-C to stop the ping command.

step.cmd: Close the xterm window on the Debian desktop (where you ran the ping command).
In the User Console, select the check box again next to your security group.
Select Manage rules from the More actions button menu.
Click Delete in front of the ICMP rule. Then click the Save changes button.
Click the plus symbol next to your security group in order to see its rules. You might have to click Refresh again to view the latest changes.

info.p: Has the ICMP rule been removed?

step.cmd: Remain logged in to the User Console.
